sources.title: The Little Match Girl (1928)
sources.description: The Little Match Girl is a 1928 French drama featurette film directed by Jean Renoir and starring Catherine Hessling.  It follows  a poor girl struggling to sell matches on New Year's Eve but is ignored by passersby. As she tries to keep warm by lighting her matches, she experiences vivid hallucinations of warmth and comfort, ultimately leading to her tragic death in the cold, where she is found smiling in the snow.

metadata.Plot: A young match girl falls into a dream state in which she enters a kind of giant toy shop, and interacts with the toys, including the captain of the wooden soldiers, but is then menaced by Death, who appears out of a jack-in-the-box wearing a kind of "pirate" outfit with a Death skull on his hat. A chase ensues, and the girl "falls back" to reality.
metadata.Actors: Catherine Hessling, Eric Barclay, Jean Storm
